column4: but it errors out saying can't find linux-restricted-modules-2.6.16-ck3
I originally followed the Breazy nvidia install using the method #2
I followed the second method for breezy which required making your own headers for the driver.
But now with dapper, all methods require the restricted modules in the repo. I don't have any precompiled kernels installed. So i was wondering Do i need to use one ?
OR can i get it working with dapper and this kernel, Because the same method (using the nvidia installer) doesn't work with dapper and 2.6.16
you are not required to use the restricted modules to install nvidia in dapper
then how do i DO it? Because the How-to only lists methods with it.
I am running the nvidia drivers and I used the installer.  Though it takes some symlinking.  Let me see if I can get you the proper instructions
I tryed doing this sudo apt-get install build-essential gcc linux-headers-`uname -r` but It complained it didnt have my linux-header-2.6.16-ck3
it wont because there are no linux headers for 2.6.16 in repo
did you try the instructions that the site I gave you gives you?
did you extract the pkg.run file and do the install that way?
please follow the instructions at the site I gave you (minus getting the headers)
